page.title: 04ST.GEORGE'S CHURCH,RODINGTON
page.content: INSIDE THE CHURCH IS COOL AND DARK EVEN IN SUMMER. AT THE BACK OF THE CHURCH BY THE BELL ROPES IS THE {CHRISTENING FONT.}IT IS ROUND AND MADE OF STONE WITH A WOODEN LID. THE {STAINED GLASS {WINDOWS }ARE OVER THE ALTAR . THE CARVED WOODEN {PULPIT }IS HIGH UP WITH STEPS TO REACH IT. THERE ARE 34 PEWS. THERE ARE SEATS FOR THE SMALL{CHOIR}OF FIVE. AT ONE TIME NO LADIES WERE ALLOWED IN THE CHOIR. OUTSIDE THE{CHURCH YARD}IS FULL OF GRAVES. THERE ARE OVER 200. THERE IS NO ROOM FOR ANY MORE PEOPLE TO BE BURIED SO THEY ARE BURIED AT THE CEMETERY BY THE VILLAGE HALL. THE LAST PERSON TO BE BURIED WAS PROBABLY IN 1927. SOME OF THE GRAVES ARE SO OLD YOU CANNOT READ THE INSCRIPTIONS.
